column4: Click the temple to sacrifice a villager. After the first sacrifice, the game will begin.
column5: Each villager has their own degree of willingness indicated by their color and consent percentage. Only sacrifice those villagers that consent to being sacrificed. If you sacrifice a villager who really isn't feeling it, as indicated by a blood coloring and exclamation marks above their label, they will negatively affect those in the sacrifice queue.
column6: The gods are impatient for blood and must have a continual flow in order to remain satiated. If the blood flow runs dry as indicated by the blood meter running in the background, the gods will be displeased and the game will end.
column7: Consensual sacrifices please the gods and will lead to more blood-time added. Less consensual sacrifices offend the gods and will decrease the amount of blood-time available. If the blood-time amount exceeds the height of the screen, blood-time will be stored in a Blood Jar for emergency use if you run out.
column8: Every so often, a special glowing villager will appear. Sacrifice this villager before their timer runs out to trigger a special organ extraction mini-game.
column9: If the rate of consensual sacrifices exceeds 9 per second, the gods will grant you with a subcontractor to sacrifice 5 villagers automatically at certain intervals. This is represented by a club icon in the top left.

column4: Villagers are fickle beasts and easily influenced by their peers. If presented with less consenting or non-consensual villagers, switch to Broker Mode with right-click or the space bar. In Broker Mode, you can rearrange villagers and positively influence them. Surround those stingy villagers with more enthusiastic ones in order to convince them to give blood. Colored arrows indicate if their consent level is increasing or decreasing.
column5: Villagers appreciate friendliness from their shepherds. If you find a stingy villager in Broker Mode, unwilling to part with their blood, simply wave your club at them until they are excited into granting their consent.
column6: Villagers can be also quickly tossed with a flick of the wrist. Note that the first and last villagers cannot be tossed.
column7: Don't worry if you can't sacrifice a villager at any given moment. With a little effort on your part, all villagers can ultimately be sacrificed.

column5: To play the minigame, first spread out all five fingers and place down on the keyboard at once. This will trigger the claw's descent. Once ready, tighten your grip on your keyboard, sliding your fingers together to more closely positioned keys.
column6: If you're lucky, you will have extracted an organ or two. If so, the claw will rotate to a basket on the side. When the claw is positioned over the basket, release your fingers to drop the organ into the bucket. The villagers rejoice at the spectacle you have presented and eagerly await their own opportunity at the altar.
column7: Extracted organs are worth differing values. The gods value the heart most of all, followed by the lungs, stomach and intestines.

column4: After gaining the gods' confidence, they will allow you to trade your blood trust in pursuit of sustainable long-term success. Items can be traded in the bottom left hand corner of your screen.
column5: Blood Jar: The Blood Jar buys the gods' patience, allowing you more time to get the blood flowing.
column6: Subcontractor: The Subcontractor allows you to automatically sacrifice villagers in timed intervals, up to five per club icon.
column7: Influencers: An Influencer can be hired to positively or negatively influence all those that fall within their sphere of influence. Upon hiring an Influencer, they are placed at the end of your queue. Drag Influencers along the queue to spread their influence.
column8: "Say Yes!" Consent Campaign: The "Say Yes!" Consent Campaign markets the idea of consent to the entire queue, educating the public on the benefits of being sacrificed.
